Vpalmr 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Compute the tangants along non-linear objects

object_tans.Rd

Estimate the tangants for points from a curved object using smoothing

object_tans(x, y, res = 1, method = c("loess", "smooth.spline"), ...)

Arguments

x

The values in the x axis
y

The values in the y axis
res

The re-sampling resolution, with the same unit as inputs.
method

The smoothing method, either using stats::loess() or stats::smooth.spline()
...

Further arguments to pass to the smoothing function

Value

The tangent for each point of a curved object

Details

The x and y coordinates must be ordered from first to last point on the object. The function is used to compute the tangents of points for a curved object. The function re-sample the object using a smoothing function to give the closest tangant to the point. The higher the resolution, the higher the sub-sampling, and the closer the tangent will be. Here is how the function works:

  1. The user sample some points from a curved object and register their X and Y positions in a euclidean coordinate system, and give the points coordinates as input of the function

  2. An approximation of the object curvature is made using a smoothing function on all measured points

  3. The object is re-sampled using the resulting smoothing function with a sampling resolution of res.

  4. The tangent is computed for each input point using the closer re-sampled points

See also

object_lenght()

Examples

# NOT RUN {
library(Vpalmr)
object_tans(x= 1:10,y= rep(1,10))
# }
